name: Electricity
description: The flow of electric charge. Powers modern civilization.

name: Generator
description: A device that converts mechanical energy into electricity.

name: Electric Motor
description: A device that converts electricity into motion.

name: Battery
description: A device that stores electrical energy.

name: Light Bulb
description: A device that produces light from electricity.

name: Electric Wire
description: A conductor for transmitting electricity.

name: Switch
description: A device for controlling electrical circuits.

name: Fuse
description: A safety device that breaks circuits when overloaded.

name: Circuit Breaker
description: A device that automatically breaks circuits.

name: Transformer
description: A device for changing voltage levels.

name: Power Plant
description: A facility for generating electricity.

name: Coal Power Plant
description: A power plant that burns coal.

name: Hydroelectric Dam
description: A dam that generates electricity from water.

name: Transmission Line
description: A high-voltage line for transmitting electricity.

name: Power Grid
description: A network for distributing electricity.

name: Electrical Outlet
description: A point for connecting electrical devices.

name: Plug
description: A connector for electrical devices.

name: Electrical Appliance
description: A device powered by electricity.

name: Refrigerator
description: A device for preserving food using electricity.

name: Washing Machine
description: A machine for cleaning clothes.

name: Vacuum Cleaner
description: A device for cleaning using suction.

name: Electric Stove
description: A cooking device powered by electricity.

name: Electric Heater
description: A device for heating using electricity.

name: Electric Fan
description: A device for moving air using electricity.

name: Radio
description: A device for receiving and transmitting radio waves.

name: Telegraph
description: A device for long-distance communication using electricity.

name: Telephone
description: A device for voice communication over distance.

name: Television
description: A device for receiving and displaying video signals.

name: Phonograph
description: A device for recording and playing sound.

name: Record
description: A disc for storing audio recordings.

name: Photography
description: The art of capturing images using light.

name: Camera
description: A device for capturing photographs.

name: Film
description: A light-sensitive material for photography.

name: Photograph
description: A printed image captured by a camera.

name: Internal Combustion Engine
description: An engine that burns fuel internally.

name: Gasoline
description: A liquid fuel for internal combustion engines.

name: Automobile
description: A vehicle powered by an internal combustion engine.

name: Truck
description: A large vehicle for transporting goods.

name: Motorcycle
description: A two-wheeled motorized vehicle.

name: Airplane
description: A vehicle that flies through the air.

name: Propeller
description: A device for generating thrust in air or water.

name: Jet Engine
description: An engine that produces thrust by expelling gases.

name: Airport
description: A facility for aircraft to take off and land.

name: Runway
description: A strip for aircraft to take off and land.

name: Petroleum
description: A liquid fuel extracted from the earth.

name: Oil Refinery
description: A facility for processing petroleum.

name: Plastic
description: A synthetic material made from petroleum.

name: Synthetic Rubber
description: A man-made material with elastic properties.

name: Chemical Fertilizer
description: A substance for enhancing plant growth.

name: Pharmaceutical
description: A medicine produced through chemistry.
